page.title: 03NEWLAND 'S FARM
page.content: NEWLAND'S FARM IS OWNED BY MR.AND MRS. GORDON JAMES.THEY HAVE LIVED THERE FOR 33 YEARS.THEY HAVE 250 ACRES OF LAND, AND THEY ARE USED IN THE FOLLOWING WAY 40 ACRES OF WHEAT,18 ACRES OF BARLEY, AND ALL THE REST IS GRASS. THEY ALSO KEEP ANIMALS SOME OF WHICH ARE PETS.THERE ARE 89 FRIESIAN CATTLE, 32 BEEF CATTLE,70 HEIFERS,110 SHEEP, 3 RAMS,200 LAMBS,50 HENS,6 DUCKS,AND 8 BANTAMS.. THE COST OF THESE ANIMALS IN TODAYS PRICES ARE AS FOLLOWING: COW- 600 POUNDS SHEEP- 75 POUNDS. MR.JAMES SAID THAT MANY FARMS LOCALLY GROW BARLEY,BUT OIL SEED RAPE IS GROWN AS A BREAK CROP. THE PRESENT FARM WORKER'S PAY IS 103 POUNDS FOR A 40 HOUR WEEK.THIRTY YEARS AGO THE PAY WAS 7 POUND FOR A 48 HOUR WEEK.
